title: Council Decision of 9 November 2000 appointing the members of the Consultative Committee of the European Coal and Steel Community
header:
Council Decision
of 9 November 2000
appointing the members of the Consultative Committee of the European Coal and Steel Community
(2000/C 352/01)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Coal and Steel Community, and in particular Article 18 thereof,
Whereas:
(1) By its Decision of 12 October 1998 the Council appointed the members of the Consultative Committee of the European Coal and Steel Community for the period ending on 11 October 2000.
(2) By its Decision of 17 July 2000(1), the Council designated the representative organisations of producers and workers required to draw up lists of candidates for the representation of producers and workers on the Consultative Committee of the European Coal and Steel Community.
(3) The representative organisations designated by the Decision of 17 July 2000 have submitted their lists of candidates for the producers and workers categories.
(4) The Governments of the Member States have presented their lists of candidates for the consumers and dealers category.
(5) The members of the Consultative Committee of the European Coal and Steel Community should be appointed for a period ending with the expiry of the ECSC Treaty on 23 July 2002,
main_body:
The following are hereby appointed members of the Consultative Committee of the European Coal and Steel Community for the period from 9 November 2000 to 23 July 2002 inclusive:
I. PRODUCERS CATEGORY
>TABLE>

The Council shall designate a representative organisation for workers from the United Kingdom at a later date.
This Decision shall be published for information in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 9 November 2000.
For the Council
The President
J. Lang
(1) OJ C 246, 26.8.2000, p. 1.
